messages.content: I like getting upgrades so I usually take it, even if it isn't always the best play
this event on defect tho
awsam

was it scrap ooze perhaps

theres an achievement for that?
no, I'm saying I've gotten achievements without remembering, so there's a chance I've died to an event without remembering as well

I think this event is bonkers. Flawed is a very tame curse overall, especially early game when your not playing draw cards much if it all. 3 random cards being upgraded is almost always going to be helpful; many characters wish to recall first instead of upgrade and this event in one of the reasons why. This event just gets even better the later you find it since you now have the chance for it to upgrade cards you added as well.
Last time I passed up on this was about 40 runs ago, where I already had two curses from other events.
oh and shout outs to automation who can benefit from flawed a concerning amount of the time

I'm just gonna have to disagree with this one tbh. It's still a card you will eventually want to remove, meaning you get stuck with 1 more strike or defend later. And also earlygame you don't have a lot of energy, so this curse can be really bad on bosses. You either have to use 1 energy on a possibly high damage turn, or you suffer losing a few cards and having them replaced with curses. This can absolutely kill you on a boss fight, like if it takes a good 2 cost damage card because the boss was also throwing up insane damage that you needed to block.

I guess I could of elaborated more on flawed. I think its simply less bad then other curses are just because you can remove it mid fight. Something like a parasite is a lot worse since you can redraw it. If you don't pay for flawed then its replacing cards with status; fortunately in act one those are almost always going to be the unupgraded defends and strikes so its not a big deal (and most statuses are also not as bad as a curse) In a short fight both flawed and parasite can feel the same if the deck doesn't cycle though (or does so like once). I don't mind losing out on a card remove if it means that those strikes and defends left in the deck are a bit better. Flawed hasnt really been that lethal for act one bosses for me; at least not any more lethal then any other curse (expect clumsy, which flawed is basically just an enhanced  version off).

I also starter relic swap very frequently, so having to pay an extra energy for flawed means less to me. Lastly, many characters have cards that target exhaust/discard that you can pick early game which can manage flawed.

lastly, I think defends are much better then strikes are in this mod (in a mid/late game context) because of how good most characters attacks are. In the base game this dynamic of removing defends vs attacks is more even; but in downfall i'm usually doing remove all strikes or a weighted ratio of 2 strike removes for 1 defend remove. So I don't think losing out on a card remove is super devastating overall and in this case I get a pretty good reward for missing out on it in exchange.
Keep in mind flawed can generate cards like <slimed> <dazed> and <wound> which are usually low impact statuses

messages.content: I will add something from myself, while this even usually upgrades at least 2 **Strikes** or **Defends** it also is quite good, as it beneficial overall, and creates a situation that is similar to scaling, which is often is something that you want for the Elites and a first Boss.
Well probably not wound
Flawed can actually be good in some cases where you have a large amount of basic cards and you need to draw into the cards you drafted to win the fight
Also if you get an early <gelatinous cube> your legally obligated to take this event
